sentence.text: The visitor sat back and watched the alchemy of the coffee take shape as the slightly stale odour of boiling milk permeated the room and steamed up the windows that looked down into Sauchiehall Street .
The odour of fried bacon surrounded him , and a dirty plate and cutlery , pushed to the corner of the table , showed that Albert had just finished his evening meal .

His nose tingled with the remembered scent of the hot oily smell which pulsed from the blaring roundabout and the acrid odour of his own hands , faintly green from clutching the brass post so tightly .
She sobbed into his cashmere overcoat , smelling the peculiar odour of him , Old Spice and cigar smoke .
She liked the grounds too , the little woods , far from the ugly clamour and harsh odours of the city .
The whole place had an odour of long-gone take-away curries and engine oil .
She fell back hard against the wall and shut her eyes , her head full of the young man 's odour .
He found its heavy odour suffocating .
While on the subject of body odour , during the sixteenth century , valerian was a popular perfume .
Sucking the wool and making it damp enhances the lanolin odour , and this keeps the cats contented and fully absorbed in their sucking and chewing .
Or enjoy a swim in the Leisure Centre situated in Eirias Park , in sparkling clear water without the usual swimming pool odours .
Sensitivity to oil fumes , coal smoke , paraffin fumes and other odours from heating systems can be tested for in the same way .
The air stank with the odour from the stalls , now freshly stocked with herring , cod , tench and even pike as the fishing fleets took advantage of a break in the weather .
She breathed in his familiar odour of best bitter and Woodbines and snuggled against him , safe and secure .
Fortunately Sybil came bustling back , distracting her , armed with clean linen , warm water and a pot from which wafted an ominous odour .
